revised_title: Cyclonic Motion and the Interpretation of Weather Charts
tldr: The author critiques Sir Napier Shaw's new theory of cyclonic motion and argues that the appearance of uniform and symmetrical instantaneous motion in a cyclone is not proof of non-symmetrical motion about a center of mass. He explains that the movements in a cyclone are similar to the movement of a wheel rolling on the ground, and that the isobars in weather charts represent the paths of the air relatively to the Earth.
